Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: உலகம் தழீஇய தொட்பம் மலர்தலும் கூம்பலும் இல்ல தறிவு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: To secure the friendship of the great is true wisdom; it is (also) wisdom to keep (that friendship unchanged, and) not opening and closing (like the lotus flower).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A majestic, unblinking, stylized eye, representing true wisdom ('அறிவு'). Its gaze is steady and unwavering.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Reflected in the pupil of this eye is the world ('உலகம்'). The connection is constant and stable. In contrast, next to the eye, a lotus flower is shown repeatedly opening in the sun ('மலர்தல்') and closing at night ('கூம்பல்'), symbolizing fickle relationships.
Layered_Composition.Background: A serene, timeless cosmic background, indicating the steadfast nature of true wisdom.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: True wisdom engages with the world in a steady, constant manner, unlike a lotus flower that opens and closes. It is not fickle.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The steady, unblinking eye represents constant, unwavering wisdom. The opening and closing lotus is the metaphor for inconsistency, which wisdom avoids.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The eye of wisdom is illuminated by a constant, internal light. The lotus is shown in a time-lapse, with the lighting changing from day to night to show its opening and closing. The palette is calm and profound.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Extreme close-up on the symbolic eye, with the lotus reflection and the actual lotus placed compositionally to create a strong contrast.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Contrasting lighting: constant for the eye, time-lapse for the lotus.

Negative_Prompt: blinking eye, static lotus, chaotic background, text artifacts, cartoonish.
